text:
Hello Guys,
How we can call API on submit data of signup form on HubSpot?

There is a forms api
<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/forms_overview|https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/forms_overview>

Hey Guys, I'm looking for some insight as to whether HubSpot has an existing API to any payroll providers. I searched the API developers page and didn't find anything and when I called they told me to come here. Any help would be appreciated as we're trying to push and pull data with our payroll company.

Hello Guys,

I’m developing a product to sync with HubSpot CRM APIs using OAuth App. I need to create Products in HubSpot but before that I want to check whether the authorised account has Products enabled (they are in paid account). Eventhough the Access Token has the `e-commerce` scope, while creating the product, it is throwing 403 due to that the account has not enabled Products (or free account). How to solve this problem or there any API to check for the features enabled??

Hello! I'm trying to connect the Five9 IVR call agent with HubSpot's Calling SDK through an  iframe. Five9 has created an iframe url to for embedding their calling agent into a webpage (the <https://app.five9.com/clients/integrations/adt.main.html?f9crmapi=true&f9verticalthreshold=300px|Five9 link> and its documentation: <https://app.five9.com/dev/sdk/crm/latest/doc/tutorial-basicintegration.html>) However, when trying to connect to HubSpot with Postman on this call: {{hostUrl}} /crm/v3/extensions/calling/:appId/setting?=(my hapikey). I have made successful connections through postman before on creating custom cards with the same Five9 iframe url, which is why I'm surprised it wouldn't work with the calling sdk? Below is a picture of the error: The module shows up, but the app won't connect to the iframe url. Does anyone understand why this is happening?

Hello!

My company is replacing HubSpot Forms for our own home-made forms for security measures. For my Marketing and Sales teams is really important to have `Original source drill-down 1` and `Original source drill-down 2` set for tracking purposes. In HubSpot UI or Workflows tool I know I can’t change these properties.

Anyone knows if I can set that property using HubSpot `Forms API` or `Contacts API` when creating the new Contact?

Hi everyone,

Does anyone have experience working with /files/v3/files? I am running into the following error when trying to create a file
`data: '<html>\n' +`
   `'<head>\n' +`
   `'<meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html;charset=utf-8"/>\n' +`
   `'<title>Error 400 Bad Request</title>\n' +`
   `'</head>\n' +`
   `'<body><h2>HTTP ERROR 400</h2>\n' +`
   `'<p>Problem accessing /files/v3/files. Reason:\n' +`
   `'<pre>  Bad Request</pre></p>\n' +`
   `'</body>\n' +`
   `'</html>\n'`

Thanks!
<@UDPJ43B39>
<@UD53A9UUR> <@UFBNA9K9A>?

highly unlikely to be available out of the box, I can probably give some advice if you have more specifics of what you are trying to do, because I hooked it up to a General Ledger and an A/R and A/P system for invoicing and billing purposes which is a similar use case

did you check the JavaScript console? my first theory would be that you are hitting one of JavaScript's infinite number of dumb browser security errors, but we need more debug output to properly comment

can you make a free instance and test it?

<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/faq/how-do-i-create-a-test-account>
that's what I do for every single thing I push to production which is new and important, before doing it in my real instance where I might cause outages or bad data to flow

it's kind of hard to say from just this, without seeing something about the payload

you might be able to get a better error message if you set `Accept: application/json` on the request to encourage the system to give you a JSON error instead of an HTML one

my opinion would be that you are very likely to get bad behavior when calling a bulk API in general, not just on HubSpot, if you do not de-dupe requests within an individual batch and consolidate those on the client side, because the behavior in a lot of databases of applying multiple conflicting writes to one row in one transaction is not always defined

for example PGSQL and Django are known to raise errors in such cases depending on the kind of `ON CONFLICT DO UPDATE` clause you use to perform upsert operations
how that works in HubSpot's code... yikes... <@UFBNA9K9A>?
I want to view custom properties on my Marketing Events Dashboard that I created using Marketing Events api. How to do that?
Any idea??

> multiple conflicting writes to one row in one transaction is not always defined
It's exactly . but our product is like a ETL tool  so some time we can't avoid to extract (and sync to HubSpot) such a email duplicated data .
